name: preposterously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a very silly or stupid way, or to a very silly or stupid degree: She claimed, preposterously, that she had never met him. It's just another of her preposterously complicated plans. He dreamt up some preposterously feeble reason why he couldn't see me. Related word

idiotically
ludicrously

More examplesFewer examplesMany people find the language preposterously complex.The prosecution are preposterously claiming that he inflicted these injuries on himself.She hopes to be a millionaire by the age of 18, which seems preposterously unrealistic.This would mean, preposterously, that when the economy is growing, he would aim to increase borrowing.
